page.title: 18BEATING THE BOUNDS
page.content: In Roman times boundary marker stones were introduced to separate different pieces of land.From that time Parish boundaries have become increasingly important and the custom developed of "Beating" the bounds when people were actually"beaten,bumped or whipped"on the boundary stones to impress upon them where the actual boundary was. Last year(1984)it was 21 years since the W.E.A.Crich branch began and 1984 was also Crich Junior School Centenary so the two organisations unite to "Beat the bounds"of Crich. Girl 1. When we "Beat the bounds",we "beat" a boy with a twig at Parkhead,just before you go down the lane to Hilltop Farm.We only did it lightly.We went on to a farm where the lady kept a peacock called Percy.She gave everyone a beautiful feather.
